[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: meter_code()] [Abort instruction cost] Abort instructions have no cost - can functions designed to always abort be used to bypass complexity limits while still affecting transaction execution? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: meter_code()] [Comparison operation chains] Comparison operations (Lt, Gt, Le, Ge, Eq, Neq) have no cost - can long chains of comparisons bypass complexity limits? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: meter_code()] [Bit manipulation operations] Bitwise operations (BitOr, BitAnd, Xor, Shl, Shr) have no cost - can bit manipulation heavy code bypass limits? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: check_module_complexity()] [Module metadata overhead] Are module metadata, source maps, and debug information excluded from complexity metering, allowing them to grow unbounded? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: check_script_complexity()] [Script parameters] Do script parameters count toward complexity, or can scripts with many parameters bypass metering? (Low)
